dynamic_line.no: Nice to see a new face around here, you one of us?  Welcome to the club, try not to step on anyone's toes.

responses.text: <neutral_greet>
I'm here for my stipend.
Nice to meet you.
Nice to meet you.  Can't stick around though.
Hate to run, but I gotta go.  See ya.

dynamic_line: I've got a shipment to handle, let's make it snappy.

responses.text: Anything that you need done around here?
Who exactly are you guys anyway?
What do you do these days?
Could you loan a poor soul any supplies?
What do you have for sale?
Where did you get all this stuff?
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Some people call us thieves, others scum, the <swear> government calls us the Hell's Raiders.  We're just some folks doin' what we need to survive is all.

responses.text: Hmm.
How'd you get to be called the "Hell's Raiders"?
What do you do these days?
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Surely you've heard of the old biker gang, the Hell's Angels?  A few of our head honchos used to run with 'em, so they named us based off that.  I know a guy who could hook you up with a bike, too.  For a price.

responses.text: Hmm.
What do you do these days?
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: I manage our supplies around here.  All the food, water, blankets, and such come through me, and I distribute them as needed.  Of course, I can always give you a bit extra if you've got the stuff.

responses.text: Hmm.
Let's see what the price is.
Who exactly are you guys anyway?
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Well, most of it came from the old cities, just waltzed on in, shot some <zombie>s, and walked out with it.  Some's been manufactured either here or elsewhere, a few people who run with us have useful skills for that sort of thing.  Some came from those we've raided, those <name_b>s work for us now, or they've been thrown to one of those <swear> hordes.

responses.text: Hmm.
Is that any way to live?
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Why the hell would you be with us if it wasn't?  For too long before <the_cataclysm>, the <swear> government didn't realize how much it oppressed people like us.  The weak <name_b>s got all the good stuff, while the strong were kept back.  Now we're on top, as the natural order of things should be.  Way I see it, that's the only <swear> way to live, the way nature goes.

responses.text: I'll take your word for it.
You're a <swear> crazy <name_b>!  Let's see who's the strongest then!
Goodbye.

dynamic_line: Here it is, come back tomorrow.

responses.text: Thanks.
